official-title.#text:
To establish and provide for the treatment of Individual
		  Development Accounts, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Savings for Working Families
			 Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited
			 as the
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text:
Sec. 4. Structure and administration of qualified Individual
				Development Account programs.

Sec. 5. Procedures for opening and maintaining an Individual
				Development Account and qualifying for matching funds.

Sec. 6. Deposits by qualified Individual Development Account
				programs.

Sec. 8. Certification and termination of qualified Individual
				Development Account programs.

Sec. 11. Matching funds for Individual Development Accounts
				provided through a tax credit for qualified financial institutions.

Sec. 12. Account funds disregarded for purposes of certain
				means-tested Federal programs.

text.#text:
The purposes of this Act are to provide for
			 the establishment of individual development account programs that will—

provide
			 individuals and families with limited means an opportunity to accumulate assets
			 and to enter the financial mainstream,

promote education,
			 homeownership, and the development of small businesses,

stabilize families
			 and build communities, and

support continued
			 United States economic expansion.

text.#text: The term

The owner of the

			 rollover, contributions will not be accepted for the taxable year in excess of

The trustee of the
			 account is a qualified financial institution.

The assets of the
			 account will not be commingled with other property except in a common trust
			 fund or common investment fund.

header.#text:
Procedures for
			 opening and maintaining an Individual Development Account and qualifying for
			 matching funds

text.#text:
An eligible individual may open an Individual Development
			 Account with a qualified financial institution upon certification that such
			 individual has never maintained any other Individual Development Account (other
			 than an Individual Development Account to be terminated by a qualified
			 rollover).

header.#text:
Required
			 completion of financial education course

text.#text:
Before becoming eligible to withdraw funds to pay for
			 qualified expenses, owners of Individual Development Accounts must complete 1
			 or more financial education courses specified in the qualified individual
			 development account program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in consultation with
			 representatives of qualified individual development account programs and
			 financial educators, shall not later than January 1, 2010, establish minimum
			 quality standards for the contents of financial education courses and providers
			 of such courses described in

and a protocol to exempt individuals
			 from the requirement under

header.#text:
Proof of status
			 as an eligible individual

text.#text:
For purposes of this Act, if,
			 with respect to any taxable year, 2 married individuals file a Federal joint
			 income tax return, then not more than 1 of such individuals may be treated as
			 an eligible individual with respect to the succeeding taxable year.

Deposits by
			 qualified Individual Development Account programs

text.#text:
The qualified financial institution shall deposit all
			 matching funds for each Individual Development Account into a parallel account
			 at a qualified financial institution.

			 ratio set by those sources.

An Individual Development Account owner may
			 withdraw any amount of funds from the Individual Development Account for
			 purposes other than to pay qualified expense distributions, but if, after such
			 withdrawal, the amount in the parallel account of such owner (excluding
			 earnings on matching funds) exceeds the amount remaining in such Individual
			 Development Account, then such owner shall forfeit from the parallel account
			 the lesser of such excess or the amount withdrawn.

			 purposes other than to pay qualified expenses.
